text: No offer letter is worth losing your mental peace over. Every time I poured my heart into 5-6 rounds of interviews and faced rejection, it felt like a punch in the gut.

LinkedIn scams be like: 'Congratulations, you've been selected for a role you didn’t even apply for!' The catch? Pay Rs. 50,000 for the honor. A recruiter once told me, 'You’re great, but not for us.'
Let this be your reminder: You’re doing your best. Looking for jobs on LinkedIn is like online dating: Full of promises, but in the end, you’re just left ghosted.

A recruiter once told me, 'You’re great, but not for us.' Next time when I'll be reading some LinkedIn Influencer's story, I am starting from the last line. If there's a link attached to it, it's most probably a fake one.
Jobseekers, this one’s for you. Every application, every interview, every follow-up… the pressure is immense. Even my dog thinks I’m employed with how much I’m on my laptop.
I once met someone who got ghosted after 9 rounds. Every time I poured my heart into 5-6 rounds of interviews and faced rejection, it felt like a punch in the gut.
Every post I read makes me feel more human. So when I left a toxic work environment, I told my manager a simple thing and felt so good.

A recruiter once told me, 'You’re great, but not for us.' Just saw a LinkedIn Influencer with 'Organic Growth' written in the profile with 65K+ followers claiming that he can help you in growing your platform, copying the posts from other influencers.
I was once told that I was too ambitious, too driven, and that I should tone it down. Today, I chose rest over endless scrolling.
